src.inference.domains.math package¶

Submodules¶

src.inference.domains.math.math_core module¶

Two-pass batch inference for Qwen2.5-style chat LMs that produce <think> ... </think><answer> ... </answer> blocks.

Resume / fill behaviour¶

  • If a results file exists (step####_<split>.jsonl), the script checks how many samples exist per problem and only generates the missing ones up to --num_samples (for example, 8). It preserves prior rows and appends the new ones.

Other features¶

  • Uses your system prompt for both passes (first message in the chat).

  • Two-phase generation per pass (think → answer) with explicit stops.

  • Per-pass hard caps: think <= 750, answer <= 50 new tokens.

  • Pass 2: shows Pass-1 output as an assistant turn, user supplies a cue, and the new <think> starts with the cue (we prefill the cue inside <think>).

  • Correctness: gold counted correct if it appears anywhere inside <answer> after canonicalization (substring check).

  • Cue-robust analytics: injected cue at the start of pass-2 <think> does not trigger “reconsider” detection.

  • EOS includes <|im_end|> and <|endoftext|>.

  • NaN-safe token entropy; optional “reconsider” slicing.

  • row_target_sample_idx – For each row, target sample index for that example.

class src.inference.domains.math.math_core.MathInferenceConfig(*, split_name: str, output_dir: str, step: int, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration for the two-pass math inference loop.

This wraps sampling-related options and second-pass settings while exposing a legacy, attribute-based interface for callers.

Parameters:

  • split_name – Dataset split name (for example, "test" or "validation").

  • output_dir – Directory where JSONL results will be written.

  • step – Training or checkpoint step identifier used in the output filename.

  • kwargs – Additional configuration options such as batch_size, num_samples, temperature, top_p, entropy_mode, eos_ids, two_pass, second_pass_phrase, second_pass_use_sample_idx, think_cap, and answer_cap.

property answer_cap: int¶

Maximum number of newly generated tokens for <answer>.

Returns:

Token cap used when generating <answer> content.

property batch_size: int¶

Batch size used for inference.

Returns:

Number of examples processed per generation batch.

property entropy_mode: str¶

Controls how token-level entropy is computed or disabled.

Returns:

Name of the entropy computation mode.

property eos_ids: List[int] | None¶

Token IDs that should trigger EOS during generation.

Returns:

List of token IDs treated as end-of-sequence markers, if any.

property num_samples: int¶

Number of samples to generate per problem.

Returns:

Number of samples drawn for each problem.

property second_pass_phrase: str¶

Cue phrase injected at the start of second-pass think blocks.

Returns:

Phrase inserted into second-pass prompts before model reasoning.

property second_pass_use_sample_idx: int¶

Preferred sample index from pass 1 to surface in pass 2.

Returns:

Zero-based index of the pass-1 sample to highlight.

property temperature: float¶

Sampling temperature for generation.

Returns:

Temperature used when sampling tokens.

property think_cap: int¶

Maximum number of newly generated tokens for <think>.

Returns:

Token cap used when generating <think> content.

property top_p: float¶

Top-p nucleus sampling parameter.

Returns:

Cumulative probability threshold for nucleus sampling.

property two_pass: bool¶

Whether the reconsideration second pass is enabled.

Returns:

True if the second pass should be run, otherwise False.

class src.inference.domains.math.math_core.MathTwoPassConfig(enabled: bool = False, phrase: str = "Hold on, this reasoning might be wrong. Let's go back and check each step carefully. ||| Actually, this approach doesn't look correct. Let's restart and work through the solution more systematically. ||| Wait, we need to reconsider. Let's think this through step by step.", use_sample_idx: int = 0, think_cap: int = 750, answer_cap: int = 50)[source]¶

Configuration of the optional second pass.

  • answer_cap – Maximum number of new tokens to generate for <answer>.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core.chat_base_for_pass1(tokenizer, problem: str) → str[source]¶

Build the base chat prompt for pass 1.

The resulting prompt includes the system message and a single user turn containing the math problem.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Chat tokenizer providing apply_chat_template.

  • problem – Raw problem text to inject into the user turn.

Returns:

A formatted prompt string suitable for generation.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core.chat_base_for_pass2(tokenizer, problem: str, prev_output: str, cue: str) → str[source]¶

Build the base chat prompt for pass 2.

The prompt includes the problem, a prior assistant reasoning trace, and a user-provided cue that will seed the new <think> block.

Parameters:

  • tokenizer – Chat tokenizer providing apply_chat_template.

  • problem – Raw problem text to inject into the user turn.

  • prev_output – Prior assistant reasoning and answer to show as context.

  • cue – Cue text that encourages reconsideration in the second pass.

Returns:

A formatted prompt string suitable for second-pass generation.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core.load_math500(cache_dir: str, split: str, seed: int, dataset_path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Thin wrapper delegating to the MATH-500 loader in math_core_runner.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core.run_inference_on_split(examples, tokenizer, model, config: MathInferenceConfig) → None[source]¶

Run math inference over a dataset split.

This wrapper delegates to src.inference.domains.math.math_core_runner while preserving the original public entry point.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core_runner module¶

Helper functions for the two-pass math inference driver.

These utilities are split out from src.inference.domains.math.math_core to keep that module within linting size limits while preserving the public API.

New code should continue to import run_inference_on_split() and load_math500() from src.inference.domains.math.math_core.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core_runner.load_math500(cache_dir: str, split: str, seed: int, dataset_path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Load MATH-500 (or a competition-math fallback) and normalize fields.

The function first tries a sequence of MATH-500 repositories. If all of them fail, it falls back to a shuffled subset of hendrycks/competition_math.

Parameters:

  • cache_dir – Directory to use as a datasets cache.

  • split – Dataset split name (for example, "train" or "test").

  • seed – Random seed used when sub-sampling the fallback dataset.

  • dataset_path – Optional local JSON file to load instead of remote datasets.

Returns:

A datasets-like object exposing map/filter and select.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If neither MATH-500 nor the competition-math fallback can be loaded.

src.inference.domains.math.math_core_runner.run_inference_on_split(examples, tokenizer, model, config: MathInferenceConfig) → None[source]¶

Run math inference over a dataset split.

The function respects existing results on disk and only generates new samples for problems and sample indices that have not yet been filled, up to config.num_samples per problem.

Parameters:

  • examples – Dataset object containing math problems and answers.

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer compatible with the underlying language model.

  • model – Causal language model used to generate solutions.

  • config – Inference configuration controlling sampling and second-pass behavior.

Returns:

None. Results are appended to a JSONL file under config.output_dir.

src.inference.domains.math.math_llama_core module¶

Two-pass batch inference for Llama-style chat LMs that produce:

<think> … </think><answer> … </answer>

DeepSpeed (ZeRO-3) edition: - Loads ZeRO-3 shards directly from checkpoint-XXX/global_stepXXXX (no merge). - Uses deepspeed.initialize + engine.load_checkpoint. - Generation goes through engine.module.generate(…).

This module adapts the generic math_core two-pass loop so that it can run with DeepSpeed-based Llama checkpoints, while keeping the CLI surface area backwards-compatible.

src.inference.domains.math.math_llama_core.load_math500(cache_dir: str, split: str, seed: int, dataset_path: str | None = None)[source]¶

Load the MATH-500 benchmark via datasets using the shared core logic.

This is a thin wrapper around src.inference.domains.math.math_core.load_math500() so that the Llama runner reuses a single implementation of the loading and normalization logic.

Parameters:

  • cache_dir – Directory to use as a datasets cache.

  • split – Dataset split name (for example, "test").

  • seed – Random seed used when sub-sampling competition-math fallback data.

  • dataset_path – Optional local JSON file to load instead of remote datasets.

Returns:

A datasets-like object exposing map and select.

src.inference.domains.math.math_llama_core.main() → None[source]¶

CLI entrypoint for the DeepSpeed-backed Llama MATH runner.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments, runs inference, and logs progress.

src.inference.domains.math.math_llama_core.run_inference_on_split(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]¶

Run two-pass math inference for a dataset split.

This is a thin adapter around src.inference.domains.math.math_core.run_inference_on_split()

that accepts the legacy keyword-only signature used by tests and the CLI while delegating the core loop to MathInferenceConfig.

param args:

Positional arguments are rejected to preserve keyword-only usage.

param kwargs:

Keyword arguments including split_name, examples, tokenizer, model, step, outdir, and optional config overrides such as batch_size or num_samples.

returns:

None. Results are written to JSONL under outdir.

raises TypeError:

If positional arguments are provided or required keys are missing.

Module contents¶

Math-specific inference domain modules.

This subpackage now hosts the two-pass core, ZeRO/LLM variants, and the shared runner helpers that previously lived in the legacy core package.
